title: Israel Returned to War in Gaza Hoping to Break Hamas. It Achieved Few, if Any, Goals.
summary: Israel ended a truce in Gaza in March, hoping to break Hamas. The move has heightened suffering for Palestinians but achieved few, if any, Israeli goals.

title: ‘Revenge Is Not a Policy’: Israelis Voice Dissent Against the War in Gaza
summary: After a long silence, prominent Israelis and activists are increasingly raising alarms about potential war crimes being carried out by the government.

title: In a First, Leading Israeli Rights Groups Accuse Israel of Gaza Genocide
summary: Israel says it is fighting against Hamas, not Palestinians as a group. But two of Israel’s best-known rights groups — long critical of Israeli policy — now say they disagree.

title: Trump Gives Russia Less Than Two Weeks to End Its War in Ukraine
summary: President Trump said he had decided to shorten a 50-day deadline he had given Russia to end the conflict or face punishing new sanctions.

title: Russia Counters Ukrainian Drones by Turning Off Russians’ Mobile Internet
summary: The same data networks that enable phone apps and web surfing help drones navigate, so officials are imposing daily, patchwork shutdowns. The actions can be very disruptive to daily life.

title: Where Is the Economy Going? A ‘Monster Week’ of News Could Help Decide.
summary: This week will bring a flood of economic data, as well as major policy decisions on trade and interest rates.

title: Economists Are Struggling to Find Jobs. It’s an Ominous Sign for The Economy.
summary: Earning a Ph.D. in economics has long been a reliable path to affluence and prestige. Not anymore.

title: Judge Blocks Trump Administration-Backed Medicaid Cuts to Planned Parenthood
summary: A federal judge in Boston ruled that a provision in President Trump’s policy bill targeting the organization most likely amounted to retaliation.

title: A Maine Resort Town Feels the Pressure of Trump’s Immigration Crackdown
summary: Wells, like many U.S. tourist spots that rely on foreign labor, is fearful of immigration raids. The local police department’s agreement to collaborate with federal agents only adds to the anxiety.

title: Durbin Demands Tapes of Interviews With Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein’s Longtime Partner
summary: The top Democrat on the Senate Judiciary Committee also pressed the Justice Department for a promise that Ms. Maxwell will not be pardoned for her cooperation in matters related to the Jeffrey Epstein files.

title: Trump Says Rupert Murdoch Should be Deposed Within 15 Days in Suit Over Epstein Article
summary: The president’s legal team argued in a legal filing that discovery process for the media mogul should be expedited because of his age and health.

title: Why ‘Mankeeping’ Is Turning Women Off
summary: As male social circles shrink, female partners say they have to meet more social and emotional needs.

title: How Parenting Changed After Etan Patz
summary: Did the shocking disappearance of a 6-year-old in 1979 forever alter how Americans raised children? Or were there other reasons for parents to be anxious?

title: Avian Flu Wiped Out Poultry. Now the Screwworm Is Coming for Beef.
summary: The parasitic fly that attacks warm-blooded animals was eliminated from the United States in the 1960s, but it’s creeping toward the Texas-Mexico border.

title: Thailand and Cambodia Agree to Halt Fighting That Has Killed Dozens
summary: U.S.-backed talks to end the border war, in which militaries have killed dozens of people and displaced hundreds of thousands, began on Monday in Malaysia.

title: Thai-Cambodian Conflict Tears at Remnants of a Once-Proud Empire
summary: People on both sides of the border share a cultural heritage much older than modern nation-states, dating back to the ancient Khmer civilization.

title: Tehran Is at Risk of Running Out of Water Within Weeks
summary: After a five-year drought and decades of mismanagement, a water crisis is battering Iran.

title: UnitedHealth Grew to Be a Leviathan. Then Came the Backlash.
summary: The conglomerate was viewed as one of the most successful companies in America, but patients are enraged and investors have lost faith in its business model.

title: U.S. Opens Antitrust Investigation Into NewYork-Presbyterian
summary: The Justice Department scrutiny of one of New York’s leading health systems could lead to more spirited competition among hospitals — and slow rising prices.

title: How Smartphones Are Breeding a New Kind of Inequality
summary: That’s bad news for our democracies.

title: Sovereignty Is Having a Moment
summary: We explain why leaders are talking so much about independence.

title: Several People Injured in Shooting at Reno Casino Resort
summary: The police said that the gunman was in custody after the attack at the Grand Sierra Resort and Casino.

title: Last Soldiers of an Imperial Army Have a Warning for Young Generations
summary: As the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II approaches, only a few veterans of Japan’s brutal war remain. “Never die for Emperor or country,” one advised.

title: Tampa Hits 100 Degrees for the First Time as Heat Grips the Southeast
summary: Extreme heat has settled across much of the region.

title: Pilot Facing Child Sex Abuse Materials Charges Is Arrested After Flight, U.S. Says
summary: The pilot was led away while the crew and passengers remained on board, according to eyewitness reports.
